page.title: 07WEST MERSEA FISHING.
page.content: In Mersea,there is a small fishing fleet of 20 boats.The boats are 30 to 50 feet long depending on the type of boat.There are some that are{beamers {crabbers}and{skifes.}The fishing boats go fishing for two or three days at a time.The boats go fishing two to twenty miles away from Mersea.When the fishing boats come in,the fish are boxed up and put on a lorry to go to {East Mersea}and{Richard Haward,}the Mersea Island fish merchant.They are weighed in and packed.The next morning they are put onto a lorry which goes to{Lowerstoft}where they are sold at a market to different buyers.The buyers then sell their wares to fishmongers who in turn sell the fish.
